translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
Fourth Section
Discussion on Rebirth
“Is one an Arahant at the moment of rebirth?”
The Invitation Ceremony.

analyzed: saha upapattiyā sa utāpannaḥ hoti iti
translated: “Is one a Stream-Enterer at the moment of rebirth?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …
“Is one an Arahant at the moment of rebirth?”
The Invitation Ceremony.
“Is one a Once-Returner at the moment of rebirth?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the abandoning of lust, the abandoning of hatred, the abandoning of delusion?
“Is one an Arahant at the moment of rebirth?”
The Invitation Ceremony.
“Is one a Non-Returner at the moment of rebirth?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …

analyzed: saha upapattiyā sa utāpannaḥ na hoti iti
translated: “Is one not a Stream-Enterer at the moment of rebirth?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci saha upapattiyā sotāpanno na hoti, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci saha upapattiyā sotāpannaḥ na hoti no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: The question.🔽If one is not a stream-enterer on the occasion of rebirth, then it must be said that one is not a stream-enterer on the occasion of dying.
“Is it proper to say: ‘One is not a Stream-Enterer at the moment of rebirth, but one is an Arahant at the moment of rebirth’?”

analyzed: saha upapattiyā sakadāgāmī na hoti iti
translated: “Is one not a Once-Returner at the moment of rebirth?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci saha upapattiyā sakadāgāmī na hoti, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci saha upapattiyā sakadāgāmī na hoti no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: The question.🔽“Suppose one is not a once-returner on coming back. Then it must be said that one is a non-returner on departing.🔽
“Is it proper to say: ‘One is not a Once-Returner at the moment of rebirth, but one is an Arahant at the moment of rebirth’?”

analyzed: saha upapattiyāḥ anāgāmī na hoti iti
translated: “Is one not a Non-Returner at the moment of rebirth?”
The Invitation Ceremony.

original: Hañci saha upapattiyā anāgāmī na hoti, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci saha upapattiyā anāgāmī na hoti no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Is it that one who is not a non-returner at the time of rebirth is not a non-returner at the time of death?”
“You may not say so.”
“Is one who is not an arahant at the time of rebirth an arahant at the time of death?”
“You may not say so.”
“Is the elder Sāriputta an arahant at the time of rebirth?”
“You may not say so.”

analyzed: mahāmoggallāno thero pe  mahākassapaḥ theraḥ pe  mahākaccāno thero pe
translated: “Is the elder Mahāmoggallāna …🔽the elder Mahākassapa …🔽the elder Mahākaccāna …
the elder Mahākoṭṭhita …
the elder Mahāpanthaka an arahant at the time of rebirth?”
“You may not say so.”

original: Sāriputto thero na saha upapattiyā arahāti?
analyzed: sāriputto theraḥ na saha upapattiyā arahāti
translated: “Is the elder Sāriputta not an arahant at the time of rebirth?”
“You may not say so.”

original: Hañci sāriputto thero na saha upapattiyā arahā, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci sāriputto thero na saha upapattiyā arahā no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Is it that one who is not an arahant at the time of rebirth is not an arahant at the time of death?”
“You may not say so.”

analyzed: mahāmoggallāno thero pe  mahākassapaḥ theraḥ pe  mahākaccāno thero pe
translated: “Is the elder Mahāmoggallāna …🔽the elder Mahākassapa …🔽the elder Mahākaccāna …
the elder Mahākoṭṭhita …

original: mahāpanthako thero na saha upapattiyā arahāti?
analyzed: mahā panthakaḥ theraḥ na saha upapattiyāḥ
translated: the elder Mahāpanthaka not an arahant at the time of rebirth?”
“You may not say so.”

original: Hañci mahāpanthako thero na saha upapattiyā arahā, no ca vata re vattabbe—🔽“saha upapattiyā arahā”ti.
analyzed: hañci mahāpanthakaḥ theraḥ na saha upapattiyā arahā no ca vata re vattabbe  saha upapattiyāḥ arahāti
translated: “Is it that the Elder Mahāpanthaka is not one who has attained arahantship at the time of rebirth, or is it not to be said that🔽he is one who has attained arahantship at the time of rebirth?”
“Is it that he has attained arahantship at the time of rebirth?”
“Yes.”

original: Upapattesiyena cittena arahattaṁ sacchikaroti lokiyena sāsavena …pe… saṅkilesiyenāti?
analyzed: upapattesiyena cittena arahattam sacchikaroti lokiyena sa āsavena pe saṅkilesiyena ati
translated: “Is it that he has realized arahantship with a mind that is subject to rebirth, that is mundane, possessed of taints, that delights in sensual pleasure, that is bound to attachment, that delights in existence, that is fostered by craving, that is subject to the corruptions, and that leads to renewed becoming?”
“That is not so.”
“Is it that he has attained arahantship at the time of rebirth?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Upapattesiyaṁ cittaṁ niyyānikaṁ khayagāmī bodhagāmī apacayagāmī anāsavaṁ …pe…
analyzed: āmantā  cittam niyyānikam khaya gāmī bodha gāmī apacaya gāmī anāsavam pe
translated: “Yes.”

“Is it that the mind subject to rebirth is emancipating, leading to the destruction of lust, hatred, and delusion; leading to the destruction of birth, aging, and death; leading to the destruction of suffering, to the relinquishment of clinging, to the exhaustion of the effluents, to peace, direct knowledge, enlightenment, and nibbāna?”

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….🔽Nanu upapattesiyaṁ cittaṁ aniyyānikaṁ na khayagāmi na bodhagāmi na apacayagāmi sāsavaṁ …pe…
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  nanu upapattesiyam cittam aniyyānikam na khaya gāmi na bodha gāmi na apacaya gāmi sa āsavam pe
translated: “That is not so.”

“Isn’t it that the mind subject to rebirth is not emancipating, not leading to the destruction of lust, hatred, and delusion; not leading to the destruction of birth, aging, and death; not leading to the destruction of suffering, to the relinquishment of clinging, to the exhaustion of the effluents, to peace, direct knowledge, enlightenment, and nibbāna; and that it is subject to the corruptions and leads to renewed becoming?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci upapattesiyaṁ cittaṁ aniyyānikaṁ na khayagāmi na bodhagāmi na apacayagāmi sāsavaṁ …pe… saṅkilesiyaṁ, no ca vata re vattabbe—🔽“saha upapattiyā arahā”ti.
analyzed: hañci upapattesiyam cittam aniyyānikam na khaya gāmi na bodha gāmi na apacaya gāmi sa āsavam pe saṅkilesiya no ca vata re vattabbe  saha upapattiyāḥ arahāti
translated: “Is it that the mind subject to rebirth is not emancipating, not leading to the destruction of lust, hatred, and delusion; not leading to the destruction of birth, aging, and death; not leading to the destruction of suffering, to the relinquishment of clinging, to the exhaustion of the effluents, to peace, direct knowledge, enlightenment, and nibbāna; and that it is subject to the corruptions and leads to renewed becoming, or is it not to be said that🔽he is one who has attained arahantship at the time of rebirth?”
“Is it that he has attained arahantship at the time of rebirth?”
“Yes.”

original: Upapattesiyena cittena rāgaṁ pajahati, dosaṁ pajahati, mohaṁ pajahati, anottappaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: upapattesiyena cittena rāgam pajahati dosam pajahati moham pajahati anottappam pajahati iti
translated: “With the consciousness that is reborn does one abandon lust, abandon hatred, abandon delusion, abandon lack of conscience, lack of shame?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …
“Is one an Arahant with the arising of rebirth-linking consciousness?”
“Yes.”

original: Upapattesiyaṁ cittaṁ maggo … satipaṭṭhānaṁ …pe… sammappadhānaṁ … iddhipādo … indriyaṁ … balaṁ … bojjhaṅgoti?
analyzed: cittam maggaḥ satipaṭṭhānam pe sammappadhānam iddhipādaḥ indriyam balam bojjhaṅgo ti
translated: “Is the consciousness that is reborn the path, the foundations of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of spiritual success, the faculties, the powers, the factors of enlightenment?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the abandoning of lust, the abandoning of hatred, the abandoning of delusion?
“Is one an Arahant with the arising of rebirth-linking consciousness?”
“Yes.”

original: Upapattesiyena cittena dukkhaṁ parijānāti, samudayaṁ pajahati, nirodhaṁ sacchikaroti, maggaṁ bhāvetīti?
analyzed: upapattesiyena cittena dukkham parijānāti samudayam pajahati nirodham sacchikaroti maggam bhāveti iti
translated: “With the consciousness that is reborn does one fully understand suffering, abandon the origin, realize the cessation, develop the path?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is one an Arahant with the arising of rebirth-linking consciousness?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: cuti cittam magga cittam upapattesiyam cittam phala cittanti
translated: “Is the death consciousness, the path consciousness, the rebirth-linking consciousness, the fruit consciousness?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
The Discussion of Rebirth is finished.
